title: Khandaghosh (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Khandaghosh (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Purba%20Bardhaman%20district">Purba Bardhaman district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>. The seat is reserved for <a href="Scheduled%20castes%20and%20scheduled%20tribes">scheduled castes</a>.
Overview.
As per order of the Delimitation Commission, No. 259 Khandaghosh (SC) assembly constituency covers <a href="Khandaghosh%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Khandaghosh</a> community development block and Adra, Bhuri, Gohogram, Khano, Maszidpur, Sanko and Satinadi gram panchayats of <a href="Galsi%20II%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Galsi II</a> CD Block.
Khandaghosh assembly constituency is part of No. 37 <a href="Bishnupur%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Bishnupur (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
The West Bengal political scenario has changed dramatically over the years. In the early years after independence it was a scene of fluctuating fortunes between the Congress and the Left wing parties, till the latter captured power in the late seventies. The <a href="United%20News%20of%20India">United News of India</a> in a candid analysis says, “The green surge swept Bengal to demolish the red bastion in 2011 Assembly elections… Moreover, as the Left still remained cornered in state politics, their neutralised voters are increasingly migrating to the BJP for a viable alternative.”
Election results.
2021.
 
2011.
In the 2011 elections, Nabin Chandra Bag of CPI(M) defeated his nearest rival Alok Kumar Majhi of Trinamool Congress.
1977-2006.
Prasanta Majhi of the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">CPI (M)</a> won the Khandaghosh (SC) assembly seat in <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006</a> defeating his nearest rival Biswanath Roy of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>. Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. In 2001, Jyotsna Singha of CPI (M) defeated Banshi Badan Roy of Trinamool. In 1996, 1991 and 1986 Shiba Prasad Dalui of CPI (M) defeated Basudev Mandal, Sankar Nath Maji and Pramatha Dhibar, all of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a>, in the respective years. In 1982 and 1977, Purna Chandra Malik of CPI (M) defeated Manoranjan Pramanik of Congress.
1951-1972.
Monoranjan Pramanik of Congress won the seat in 1972. In 1971, the seat was won by Purna Chandra Malik of CPI (M). Gobardhan Pakray of <a href="Samyukta%20Socialist%20Party">Samyukta Socialist Party</a> won it in 1969. P. Dhibar of Congress won the seat in 1967. Jaharlal Banerjee of Congress won it in <a href="1962%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1962</a>. Khandaghosh constituency was not there in 1957 and in <a href="1952%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1951</a> it was a general constituency. It was won by Jb Md Hossain of Congress.
